solution_line_template: Darnell would pay {texts_sent} / {texts_per_dollar} = <<{texts_sent}/{texts_per_dollar}={texting_charge_multiplier}>>{texting_charge_multiplier} times the $1 texting charge per month.
He would pay {minutes_spent} / {minutes_per_three_dollars} = <<{minutes_spent}/{minutes_per_three_dollars}={call_charge_multiplier}>>{call_charge_multiplier} times the $3 call charge per month.

He would pay {texting_charge_multiplier} * {cost_per_30_texts} + {call_charge_multiplier} * {cost_per_20_minutes} = {texting_cost_subtotal} + {calling_cost_subtotal} = $<<{texting_charge_multiplier}*{cost_per_30_texts}+{call_charge_multiplier}*{cost_per_20_minutes}={alternative_plan_cost}>>{alternative_plan_cost} per month on the alternative plan.
Thus, Darnell would pay {current_plan_cost} - {alternative_plan_cost} = $<<{current_plan_cost}-{alternative_plan_cost}={savings}>>{savings} less on the alternative plan.
